{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3502582,"name":"","username":"LHACK4142","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lhack4142/{size}/196107_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T06:27:01.573Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to use a FlywheelSim for an intake, but the only constructor available takes
the following:

class FlywheelSim(
    plant: LinearSystem_1_1_1,
    gearbox: DCMotor,
    measurementStdDevs: list[float] = [0]
)

I don’t know how to use this (something to do with sysid???), and it seems that the class should have another constructor with the following parameters (because the javadocs say the equivalent java class has this constructor, and because the other mechanism simulators have similar constructors):

  • gearbox - The type of and number of motors in the flywheel gearbox.
    gearing - The gearing of the flywheel (numbers greater than 1 represent reductions).
    jKgMetersSquared - The moment of inertia of the flywheel. If this is unknown, use the FlywheelSim(LinearSystem, DCMotor, double, Matrix) constructor.
","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-02-05T06:27:27.604Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":485263,"topic_slug":"flywheelsim-missing-constructor-with-gearbox-in-robotpy","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://first.wpi.edu/wpilib/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/simulation/FlywheelSim.html#%3Cinit%3E(edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem,edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.DCMotor,double,edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FlywheelSim (WPILib API 2023.4.3)","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58301,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"coder in the corner"},"post_url":"/t/flywheelsim-missing-constructor-with-gearbox-in-robotpy/485263/1","custom_user_title":"coder in the corner","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3502585,"name":"Noah Simon","username":"tubularturtle8","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tubularturtle8/{size}/209634_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T07:04:15.968Z","cooked":"

Hello!

I was also quite confused with this change into 2025, but there’s a relatvely simple work around. The LinearSystem class can be created with LinearSystemID which will take the following:

  • Motor (the gearbox, as you put it)
  • Moment of Inertia
  • gear ratio

This can then be put as the LinearSystem object in the FlywheelSim’s constructor. Do note, this is done in Java.

Here is a screenshot of our team’s code for it, hope this helps!

image1006×120 9.91 KB

Edit: I see your team is going to Ventura, best of luck, and see you there!

LHACK4142:

use the FlywheelSim(LinearSystem, DCMotor, double, Matrix) constructor.

This is a link to the 2023 Java docs, not 2025.
